content.description: Do some cool steep gym-like moves on crimps, and stand up on the slopey ledge to the right.  Apparently, most people just drop off from here, but I think the finish is awesome and totally worth doing.  It's much easier than the start, but it's really high and kinda scary.
content.location:
If you are looking at

Ode to Failure

, this problem is directly behind you, on the right side of the big boulder.  Start on two low crimps with lots of chalk.

content.description:
SDS down and left on a blocky jug, and climb into

The Syringe

. Sharp crimps and hard heel hooks appear to be the name of the game on this one.
content.location:
It is left of

The Syringe

.

content.description: This problem is described in the free NOCO climbing guide for Lory State Park: "Traverse the large ledge/sloper from right-to left ending on a sloping ledge." Keeping your right heel in the crack and smearing your right foot seems to be the preferred beta.
content.protection: Since you are horizontal most the time, a pad and someone to move it along under you can be nice.
content.location: Moby's Traverse is located on the back side (NW) of the Syringe Boulder. The rail that you follow is about three feet off the ground and is hard to miss.

content.description:
Start in the middle of

Moby's Traverse

, and head straight up with a hard compression move out left and then up via sharp edges. It has an airy topout.
content.location:
This starts in the middle of

Moby's Traverse

.

content.description:
This is a beautiful line with a clear crux sequence involving a high left hand gaston. Start on a juggy, right-facing sidepull/undercling, and quest upward!

Move a little left at the top before coming back right to surmount the final bulge with some airy but increasingly easier moves.
content.protection: A spotter!! and a couple of big pads should suffice. It is kind of hard to pad the landing.
content.location:
It is just right of

The Enchanting Wizard of Rhythm

, in the subtle dihedral.

content.description:
Start seated matched on sidepull rail, move up your right hand, and then 'float' with difficulty up to the left hand sidepull.

Make sure to top out as for

The Syringe

.
content.location:
This is to the right of

The Syringe

.

content.description:
This is one of the better highballs in Northern Colorado and is every bit as good as

Childbirth

. It is very rarely repeated.

“Start on an undercling, and move up the seam to good edges. Continue up the face just right of the arête to a scary exit move at the lip.”
content.protection: As many pads as you can get, they don’t really do much....
content.location: It is the first line you see on the Syringe Boulder and is on your left as you come up through the corridor from the warm-ups.
